import { Meta } from '@storybook/blocks'

export const RightArrow = () => <svg
    viewBox="0 0 14 14"
    width="8px"
    height="14px"
    style={{
      marginLeft: '4px',
      display: 'inline-block',
          shapeRendering: 'inherit',
          verticalAlign: 'middle',
          fill: 'currentColor',
          'path fill': 'currentColor'
        }}
    >
      <path d="m11.1 7.35-5.5 5.5a.5.5 0 0 1-.7-.7L10.04 7 4.9 1.85a.5.5 0 1 1 .7-.7l5.5 5.5c.2.2.2.5 0 .7Z" />
    </svg>

    <Meta title="Introduction/Contribution" />

    <div className="sb-container">
      <div className='sb-section-title'>
        # Contribution

        If you want to add own component to particular UI kit - you must follow next steps:

    ##  Create component directory

    Each component must have own directory. You can create own directory inside subdirectories of **src/components** directory. Choosing subdirectory depends on which kind of component do you want to create. Like radio button component must be inside **form** subdirectory.

    ## Proper file structure

    Each component must contain all those files:

    * **Component.vue** - component itself.
    * **Component.scss** - styling for component, imported inside *vue* file.
    * **index.ts** - file which contain default reexport of *vue* file.
    * **Component.test.ts** - test case for particular component.
    * **Component.stories.ts** - config file for add your component to *Storybook* docs system.
    * **README.md** - just little description of your awesome component.

    ## Add your component to build system

    After adding component,  you must configure build system for it. Go to file **/vite.config.ts** and add path to **index.ts** file inside your component to section *build.lib.entry*. Please, use your component name as a key.

    ## Add export manifest

    Now you can go to file **/package.json** then add your component to *exports* section, also using component name as a key.
  </div>
</div>
